paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: The paper discusses transthyretin amyloidosis (TTR-CA) and mentions variants in the TTR gene, specifically focusing on their clinical significance, penetrance, and associated phenotypes.

patients.demographics: Age range not specified, includes both male and female patients
patients.phenotype: Patients with TTR-CA, including wtTTR-CA and vTTR-CA forms

individual_records.phenotype_details: Cardiac amyloidosis with heart failure symptoms
individual_records.evidence_sentence: The first group comprised wtTTR-CA (n = 10), vTTR-CA (n = 5) and AL-CA (n = 9) patients.

individual_records.phenotype_details: Cardiac amyloidosis with reduced exercise tolerance
individual_records.evidence_sentence: Patients with CA usually develop symptoms with physical activity because of rising filling pressures.
The first group comprised wtTTR-CA (n = 10), vTTR-CA (n = 5) and AL-CA (n = 9) patients.

functional_data.summary: The study indicates that MCF and SV are predictive of mortality in TTR-CA patients.

variants.segregation_data: The variant segregates with disease in families as indicated by the presence of affected individuals.
variants.additional_notes: The study highlights the importance of SV and MCF in assessing TTR-CA.
key_quotes: Patients with CA usually develop symptoms with physical activity because of rising filling pressures.
The first group comprised wtTTR-CA (n = 10), vTTR-CA (n = 5) and AL-CA (n = 9) patients.

extraction_metadata.notes: The extraction was straightforward as the paper provided clear information on the TTR variant.
